reviewText: One of the most notorious anti Semitic movies ever made, filmed in Germany in 1940, under the close supervision of Nazi propaganda minister Joseph Goebbels. This was based on a real case and a furthernovel by Jewish author Lion Feuchtwanger - obviously, the Nazis completely distorted the source material so that this film is completely anti-Semitic. The movie was a huge success at its time - millions of Germans watched it and SS boss Heinrich Himmler made viewing the movie mandatory for every member of his organization. Today the film is banned in Germany.In 18th century Germany, the foolish duke of Wurttenberg decides to make the Jewish businessman Joseph Suss Oppenheimmer his financial adviser. Soon disaster will come to the dukedom, in the form of a higher cost of living (under advice from Suss, the duke sharply rises all sort of taxes). Suss also advices the duke to let the Jews enter Wurttenberg (from where they were banned from residing). Eventually, the members of Wurttenberg council, decides to rise against the duke and his adviser.Ironically, in some ways the message of the movie looks different today than originally intended. To a modern audience, the Germans in the movie are so nave, ignorant and narrow minded that they seem offputting, while Suss appears to be, until he turns into a rapist and torturer toward the end, not such a bad guy, just a sharp, quick if a bit ethically loose businessman. Putting tolls in the roads of Wurttenberg doesn't look to be such a bad thing, while the politicians of the council opposing Suss seem uptight, arrogant and pompous. The character of Faber seems an unbearable, prejudiced young hothead, while his wife Dorothea, the Christian girl Suss strives for and that will be one of the causes of his downfall (played by Kristina Soderbaum, wife of director Veit Harlan) is so dumb and foolish, one feels she is not really worth the trouble. Even the portrayal of the rabbi of the community seems almost positive to a modern audience: he tells Suss to be very careful in his political dealings with the Germans, lest this backfire on the Jewish community.Ferdinand Marian gives an amazing multifaceted performance as the cunning but magnetic Suss, without him the movie would be far less powerful than it is. Finally, I give this movie a high rating because I think is very well made - I certainly find its message hateful.
summary: Very well made if hateful propaganda film

reviewText: Ironically the lesson of this film is:Beware of silver tonged political leaders that promise wealth and superiority by use of immoral means.One such person, fitting this description, became Chancellor in 1933, weird?The quality of the video transfer is not that good, many artifacts and lines are constantly seen on screen.  I doubt any restoration or clean up was done in the transfer.

reviewText: This movie takes the story of one bad and greedy Jew, and applies it to all Jews. This logic is as disgustingly corrupt as drawing the conclusion that all Muslims are terrorist based on a movie about Bin Laden!However, the negative effects of this movie were unimaginable; it became number one in 1939, and was shown to SS units and to non- Jewish audiences, after which anti-Jewish violence increased dramatically.Judge for yourself, you might see it as a bad movie because of the anti Semitic content, or you might think it's great historical documentation that projects the Nazi's anti Semitism and corruption. This is the Nazi's own admission of biased violence and hatred. Watch this movie, take a deep breath of history and know how putrid it is!
summary: One star or five stars? You decide!

reviewText: At one point in this film, a character states, "no one is as smart as a Jew."  Yes, that was said in this film, a movie that Hitler approved of.  I was pretty shocked.  That tells me that the Nazis not only despised the Jews, they felt intimidated by their intelligence as well.  I also thought that this film, while mainly depicting Jews as evil, showed the Germans to be naive fools who allowed their city and everything in it to be easily taken over by a single Jew.  Honestly, I'm surprised that the German society at the time was not insulted by this film.  If I were German, I would feel insulted, but that was then, and this is now.  Perhaps my perspective is different because times have changed.  A whole country was brainwashed by a mad man, so I suppose people were walking around with blinders on.In a way, although this film depicts those "evil Jews," I also thought it was a knock on German Christian society.  To me, it was like reading between the lines of a book, if you look deeply enough.I feel that this film is an important piece of historical work given the context of the Holocaust and the persecuation of the Jewish people.  However, it should be studied not only as a piece of inflammatory hatred during the worst period in human history, but as a piece that allows us to get into the minds of the perpetrators.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This movie is an excellent propaganda vehicle, there's nothing you can say about it. Show this film to a little kid, and that kid's gonna hate Jews forever. Guaranteed.All dictatorships have their ideological vehicles. And usually they tend to be very well crafted and performed: "Triumph of the Will" from Nazi Germany, "Battleship Potemkin" from USSR, "The East Is Red" from China o "Yo Soy Cuba" from the island of Fidel... Even the US had their propaganda film in "The Birth Of A Nation".After seeing this one, one wonders how many movies Hollywood has made depicting other ethnic groups as evil, lascivious, subhuman and death-deserving? I can remember a lot of movies with Amerindians, Africans, Hispanic, Japanese, Germans, Russians, Vietnamese and Arabs, all of them portrayed as so heinous, so cruel and so beastly, that people watching these films wish them all killed till the last one... And nobody calls them "propaganda", which obviously they are!Sometimes, I don't see the difference between "Jud Suss" and "Rambo", "Black Hawk Down" or "Rules of Engagement".By the way, the actor Ferdinand Marian didn't commit suicide. He died in an car accident in 1946, the same day he was merrily driving to Munich, to receive his denazification papers that would allow him to work as an actor again... Bad luck for him.
